snippet: There were cheers, boos, world records, relegations and a fifth career gold medal during the opening day of track cycling.
abstract: British track cycling team wins men's sprint at the 2012 Olympics in a world-record time of 42.60 seconds; cyclist Chris Hoy ties the British career record with his 5th Olympic gold medal.
lead_paragraph: There were cheers, boos, world records, relegations and a fifth career gold medal during the opening day of track cycling.

headline.seo: Cyclist Hoy Ties British Olympic Record With 5th Gold Medal
headline.main: Briton Emerges From Velodrome’s Chaos With a 5th Gold
headline.print_headline: Briton Emerges From Velodrome’s Chaos With a 5th Gold
